explanation: The first sentence of section 1.1 (a) states that Provider agrees to provide services. However, the second sentence states that Provider is not obligated to respond to any request by Recipient for access to any additional services and resources that are necessary for the operation of the Recipient and which are not currently contemplated in the Exhibit, unless Provider deems it fit and feasible. These two statements contradict each other and make it seem that the Provider does not need to provide services even though it has agreed to.

Section 1.2 (c) says that Provider Representatives shall be dedicated to solely providing the Services to Recipient and shall not provide any such services or resources to Provider or any other customer of Provider. However, section 1.1 says that Provider is not obligated to respond to any request by Recipient for access to any additional services and resources. These two statements contradict each other. If the provider is not obligated to respond and provide services, why would the provider's representatives solely be dedicated to providing services?

Section 3.1 states that the agreement shall terminate on December 31, 2020, unless terminated earlier in accordance with Section 3.2. However, Section 3.2 allows either party to terminate the agreement at any time without cause by providing 90 days' prior written notice. If section 3.2 allows termination at any time, this contradicts that the agreement shall terminate on December 31, 2020.
